name: Adrian Fann
text: We had problems with soot coming out of our gas fireplace and wind and rain coming in. We purchased a fireplace insert from Atnip and it solved our problem. We were extremely pleased with the time they took to explain the many options and the computer image of how our existing mantle would look with the chosen insert. They took time to explain the remote in detail. I would definitely recommend them

resp.text: It was our pleasure to work with you. We are glad to hear you are completely satisfied. We strive to have happy customers. Please let us know if we can help you in the future.

name: John Fishman
text: If I could give a"0" star I would. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY! We have a gas fireplace installed by Atnip at least 10 yrs ago (before we bought house). In the yrs we've been here we had them out at least once every year and it still has never worked right. Since JANUARY (!) I've been trying to schedule a service appt with them. We finally were able to schedule something today and I took the day off for it. I did miss their call - my ringer was off. But they always text and their were no texts and they said they were AT THE DOOR ready to work but no one answered it. They NEVER knocked so they were lying! Then they argued with me NOT about the lying but about my ringer being off! Typical old school Huntsville Southern business that still works as if its the '70s and there's no one else to go to. They apparently don't care about the axioms: "The customer is always right."  or "Customer comes first."  I am just ashamed I tried to work with them for so long. . AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! We

resp.text: Our policy is to ring the doorbell and knock on the door multiple times before we proceed to call or text the homeowner. Multiple attempts were made to contact the homeowner, but we eventually had to move to the next job as contact was never made.

name: James Dint
text: Excellent service! Atnip has been around the area for as long as I can remember and I can't recommend them more. Huge showroom with lots of options to look at. I believe their installers (both named Mike if I remember correctly) were very knowledgeable and did an excellent job of installing my gas fireplace. I will continue to use them!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your business! We are very blessed to have Mike and his 25+ years with us.

name: Pat Ragan
text: Just had a new gas fireplace and mantel install last week. The workman ship was great. The workers were very professional in the work they did. They were very friendly and polite. I would definitely recommend  them for your fireplace and installation needs.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your business! Hope you are still enjoying your fireplace!

name: M B
text: Mike was wonderful, very knowledgeable and a perfectionist, love our new fireplace would highly recommend atnip

resp.text: Thank you very much! We are very blessed to have Mike and for 25+ years. We hope you enjoy your new fireplace. Thank you for your business!

text: Really nice young man working the entrance..just used garden department for good parking and getting out of the store faster

name: Kiwi Pettway
text: Lines are always ridiculously long.  The employees are mostly standing around  chit chatting.

name: Rusty Shelby
text:
Hello, Hello? Hello is anyone working here . . . unfortunately today was challenging finding someone, anyone who worked there.

Walmart right?

name: Audrey Bazzell
text: It was very clean and all but the few plant they happened to have was all super dry. Other than that it's great. They were in the process of receiving more plants and gardening supplies in

name: Judy Ingram
text: Rearranged products hard to find ,or needs restocking, pay same prices for products and have to check yourself out, if I have to check myself out and bag prices need to drop down

name: Barry Lewis
text:
I know that places like Walmart Stores have been here for many years. I am an old hippie and old school school . Just personally the mom and pop have faded into history....I don't think I am the only human that has noticed the extinction of days gone by"Mom&Pop"stores. Most people don't like change...I know to survive in the era of technology the human equation has to change or get left out and sadly we have to adapt to a different environment. Don't take my bicentennial moments of rambling that seriously . I will say that my experience at Walmart today was very good.  More particular is that my squirrels and varieties of birds are really happy! Once again share stories and dine on songbird seeds that I purchased can not be found locally except Walmart or Amazon online.
Tonight's movie is a classic titled [Don't Bend Over In The Pea Patch cause Them Taters have Eyes]"FILM AT 11:00PM

name: Tara Flowers
text: They still have beautiful flowers for sale. Very few Bonnie plants. They also have plenty of seeds but if you are looking for collards or turnips look elsewhere.

name: James “Jay” Casey
text: Looking for great plants for your garden this summer?  Home Depot at Crestwood Festival Center even has heirloom varieties of tomato plants you will not find other places.

name: Ken Jackson
text: A bit over priced on most of their inventory but they are also the only game in town for a lot of things electrical. They carry a good inventory of plumbing supplies as well. Their employees are generally well-versed and helpful. Next door to Tractor Supply

name: OneAndOnly Bama
text: Went by today to get a shark bite fitting, lowes and home depot was both sold out of most of the ones I needed. Always heard electrical outlet was higher priced than the big stores. No sir they are not same price and had everything in stock awesome place.

name: Wendell Hill
text: Go there often.

name: Steve Edwards
text: Good place for your electrical needs.

name: Mike Sprinkle
text: Knowledgeable friendly staff.   Great supply of products.

name: NameHidden ForPrivacy
text:
Bought a brand new Stihl chainsaw from this establishment.   After 20 minutes of running the saw broke and needed a new head.

First Stihl gave me a hard time about the saw, made me take pictures of an obviously brand new saw and after a lot of hull-a-ba-loo agreed to fix the saw.

Then they had Electrical Outlet fix it.  It took Electrical Outlet six months to fix the saw.

Went back into Electrical Outlet today (a year later after the saw fiasco) and put $300 dollars worth of material into my buggy.

I went to get a log chain and requested help from the owner, a Mr. Alexander.

He helped me get the chain and I requested help obtaining hooks to put on the end of the chain.

I had some reservations about the eye hooks, such as would they be as sturdy as the chain itself.  What type was better, etc.

During this question session three men came up to us and interrupted our conversation.  Mr. Alexander then just left me standing there with a couple of different hooks in my hand and walked away to discuss college football with what were apparently his friends.

So, I shopped a bit more, patiently waited at the front desk while these four people gabbed about college football.

When Mr. Alexander finally decided to check me out I indicated I was not happy with his leaving me standing there.

While explaining this I did not raise my voice or act rudely, I simply told him I wasn't happy with the service level provided.

It was at this time that Mr. Alexander decided to go ballistic on me.

I got a good reaming out by him.  For good measure he also tossed in a few choice four letter words.

I told him that I was having a difficult time being calm with him.

To that he pointed at the door and told me to get out.

I then told him about my chain saw experience and that I had refrained from criticizing the store about the poor service because one of his young employees had been very nice to me during a weather emergency we had April 27th, 2011.

Once again I got told where the door was and to use it.

So, I proceeded to do so.

As I was opening the door he shouted at me "You must be another one of those Terry's".  I promptly told him who I was and spelled my name out for him.

I try to support local businesses, but he effectively sent me next door to Tractor Supply (where I got everything I came to town for anyway).  Guess it will be Tractor Supply or Lowes in the big city from here on out.

Good luck with your attitude Mr. Alexander.  It will take your business straight down!

name: George Davis
text: Excellent customer service

name: George Wolff
text: Not very well stocked considering it's spring planting season soon

name: Diedre Senn
text: No one came to work today. Had to wait 30 minutes to get paint. Waited over 30 minutes for material, never got the material.

name: Phillip Hale
text:
Terrible store. You’ve got order pickup spots taken up by people who aren’t picking online orders up, people rolling carts in random directions(literally hitting other peoples cars), trash all across the parking lot. Cops parked outside but not enforcing road laws. Sitting in 95+ degree heat waiting for people to do their job and bring bags to the car. People want 15/hr. But can’t do the simplest part of their job.

Walmart should go ahead and shut this one down. Not worth the money to upkeep, paying employees to not do their job. Trash.

name: Robert Carrell
text:
I did a severe review regarding referral that Trevor gave me and it cost $9000 without doing them doing the job correctly.  Trevor replied that he gave me several referrals, with the implication that choosing five star was my decision.  I'm willing to take PART of the blame, but my contention is that if you don't know the quality of work of the people that you refer would- be customers to, then you shouldn't refer them.  Trevor's name and reputation is behind his referrals, no matter how you look at it.  I would not have considered the referrals seriously if I had known that Trevor didn't know anything about these people from Five Star Landscaping.  The only other possibility is that Trevor DID know the lack of honesty, deliberate fraudulent words and actions, and basic dishonesty of the 5 Star rogues.  Is there a third possibility?  Help me out here.  When I was in practice, I never made referrals to anyone who's quality of work I wasn't aware of... Am I missing something here?  I don't think so.
ADDENDUM 04/06/21.
Apparently, the five star crook talked with Trevor because now he knows ALL?... of the details.  Let me fill you in.  Trevor says that this shouldn't be a public issue.  REALLY??  This SHOULD be a public issue.  The one that doesn't want a public issue is the one who has something to cover up.  The photos below show the tearing up of my irrigation system and electrical controls of the gates for the irrigation. Also, the pix show the  excavation within 16" of my wall. I'd asked for the path to be at LEAST 36" from the wall.  So, they wiped out all of my wisteria roots.  Also, I did NOT get a 100% refund.  The only way I got $9000 was to threaten them with my recording of the exit meeting.  Until then, they were gonna keep $9800, fully half of the project price.  After my disclosure of the recording of the exit meeting, they sent me $9000.  Does anyone feel that they deserve $800 for the mess shown in the photos below. THAT'S WHAT THEY LEFT ME WITH.  The photos below tell the real story.  Would anyone pay $800 for this mess?.  The materials I "received" was a pile of "mulch" that they were gonna use instead of removing the grass sod that I had requested be removed.  The two "employees" either didn't know how to use a shovel or were too lazy to dig out the turn in the pix.  So, they ran their 36" powered bucket down the projected path and didn't bother to turn when they should have turned, destroying my  three year old wisteria roots.  See photo.  I'd have paid $800 just to leave my yard alone.  So, I had to pay to have my irrigation system repaired, and talk someone else into doing the actual project I wanted done in the first place.  No one likes to come in and finish a project that is screwed up from the get-go. NO ONE WILL ADMIT IT WHEN THEY SCREW UP A JOB!
So, Trevor, what I want you to do is to BE HONEST..

resp.text: Robert this should not be a public argument. I know Five Star and we have lots of good reviews of work they have done. The fact that you and them could not work together is beyond my control. That said, as outlined in my previous response, your received the materials, 9 days of free labor and 100% of your money refunded. What more do you think I should do?

name: David Morris
text: 5 star ++! I am a fair as stone mason but I had a project that I did not really know what to do with. I went into Across the Pond Hardscapes  and Mo, the Manager at the Madison store, listened and then gave me exact advice on what to use. I made multiple trips there and every time he was willing and able to give advice, or just let me bounce ideas off him. do not believe any negative comments about this location or Across the pond in general because they may be factually inaccurate.

resp.text: Hello David. Thank you for your fabulous review. Mo has worked for us several years and he is a highly respected and committed member of our team. We truly appreciate your feedback.

name: Jimmie Parvin
text:
Save your time! They have no cuteness service! I visited early today and they was one employee there. He was helping (actually just following a couple around, not waiting an order, etc) a couple and would not help anyone else. Two customers ahead of me left in frustration and then I finally did the same. Later in the afternoon I decided to give them another try and went back.
The employee meet me immediately to tell me they were closed, they close at 4:00.  I'll skip the hassle and shop someplace that actually wants my business.
This review is for the Madison location.
Since I live in Madison, I see no point in wasting more of my time going to the Meridianville location.

resp.text:
Hello Jimmie. I am sorry we disappointed you. According to our employee you arrived at 4.38 pm and we close at 4 pm. We have seen a large increase in customer volume at both stores and it has been near impossible to keep up. To make matters worse it has been hard to hire more staff due to COVID scares and restrictions. Everywhere I shop I experience increased wait times and we are suffering the same dilemma. We are thankful for the great boost in business and appreciate the loyal support we receive from our valued customers. Mo, the employee you are referring to is a longtime, hard working, well loved member of our Across The Pond team. What is it that you need? I can help you. Trevor Cole, Owner.
Cheerio!

name: Joseph Dewberry
text: Marurice is always helpful and attentive. I understand that only one employee works at this location and sometimes I have to wait to be served but the service received is top notch. If you're in a hurry or want the cheapest in town go to Lowe's if you want a knowledgeable person to walk you through a project go see Marurice.

resp.text: Thank you, Joseph.

name: Herb Hughes
text: Great place. Beautiful patios! Everything you need for outdoor living.

resp.text: Thank you, we appreciate your feedback. Cheerio!

name: Hank Campbell
text: We are a hardscape supplier. We provide products to homeowners and contractors. Come in and check out our showroom.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Poppi Gee
text: Wasnt very helpful and a little pricey.

resp.text: Thank you, for your review. What were you looking for? On the products we sell we are very knowledgeable, I am surprised we couldn't help. I disagree with your comment regarding pricey. We are never knowingly undersold. We check prices on everything we sell and we know we are competitive with all other sellers, including online. We do sell better quality products than the typical box stores and our prices are higher. Can you buy a Ford at the same price as a BMW? Tell what products, in your opinion, were pricey? Thank you.

name: Christina Barnett
text: Mo really went above and beyond today! Thank you guys for everything.

resp.text: Thank you, we appreciate your feedback. Cheerio!

name: Rhodeah2010
text: Great selection of landscape rocks and the service was excellent — very pleased with how our project turned out!

name: Martin Bachtel
text: Woerner is great.  They have an excellent tightly-knit staff that works well together.   It is my number one go-to place for sod.  They have the best combined prices on pallets and delivery in the metro.  I can’t say enough good things about the Tif Tuf Bermuda that they offer.  They also have a huge array of shrubs and trees.

resp.text: Thank You!

name: Andrew McCurry
text: Always willing to help load you up and get you out the door fast. That is important when you are trying to run a production based business.  Knowledgeable friendly staff. Great selection of plants and stone.

name: Er Tu2
text: I have always received prompt and courteous service from the knowledgeable staff. Highly recommended.

name: Joaquin Maldonado
text: Good place

name: Taylor Hardscapes
text: The management and staff at Woerner Landscaping are incredibly helpful and knowledgeable. Fantastic customer service you won't get anywhere else. Great selection and pricing.

name: Eric Beavers
text: Wide selection, knowledgeable & helpful staff. Convenient to Jefferson Shelby area. Delivery for larger  orders.

name: Jason Ciccarelli
text: Great people

resp.text: Thank You!

name: Ben Thomas
text: Great customer service and tons of knowledge.  The entire team there is top-notch. If you're looking for plants or hardscape material,  Woerner is the place to go.

name: Blake Jones
text: Great customer service! Friendly staff. Always there to help with any questions or concerns. Large selection of plants, stone, and sod

name: Bernard Doug Cook

text: Built a deck and walkway at my house last fall. David and the crew in Mobile helped with materials and advice. I got a great deal on some cut stone, sand, gravel, dirt, beach pebbles, and sod. Planted a flower bed in a galvanized trough and used the gravel for drainage. Built the walkway with the cut stone and used the beach pebble around some of the bushes. The grass took some time since I planted it in the fall, but it came out great in the spring. I will definitely be back for my next DIY project.

resp.text: Thanks for the detailed review, B C!

name: Michael Thompson
text: I’m a concrete contractor that uses these guys from time to time. They are a bit expensive, but I don’t mind paying for good service and quality products. We have purchased gravel, wall blocks, pavers and stones from them in the past. I always recommend them to customers for any of their personal landscaping needs. I went in to purchase some pea gravel and when I reminded the girl at the front desk that I should get contractor price, she was extremely rude. I probably would have went ahead and got an account, but she was so rude and disrespectful I never had a chance. Her name is Carla and I suggest someone in management teach her manners. I’ll use other stores for my products and not recommend them anymore if this is how they could be treated. By the way, I can go a bit further and get gravel from one of the trucking companies for half the cost.

resp.text: Michael, We are sorry about your experience at our store. We hope that you will give us another chance later down the road.

I will no longer do business with you and I will also no longer suggest you business to others. If you dont want the business close the location instead of doing business the way you are.

Also any question about sod, pavers, insecticides, watering schedules, they are very friendly and helpful in answering any questions I had. Steven, Carla, and all the guys inside and those helping to load outside are very friendly and good people. I'm happy to do my business with them and will continue to do so knowing that their expertise and products are very good. Even if you are not sure about something, I would recommend going in person or calling them, they are very helpful. 5/5 for me.

name: Martin Bachtel
text:
Primarily they sell wholesale to landscapers but they also cater to retail customers.  The majority of their business comes from landscapers and contractors. The place is huge, about 10 acres, and you can drive the property in your vehicle instead of walking it.   The staff is mostly college horticulture graduates or seasoned veterans in the business, and very professional, as opposed to Hanna’s Nursery down the street, which is mostly teenagers still in high school hired as cheap labor to BS customers, with zero knowledge of horticulture. It all starts with the excellent leadership and the rest of the staff is reflected by that.   They sell: trees, shrubs, perennials, annuals, mulch, pine straw, bulk materials like top soil and sand, several types of stone and rock for hardscape projects, irrigation supplies, drainage supplies, construction materials like cement , a wide array of tools for landscaping and beyond, safety equipment, anything that has to do with agricultural chemical applications, bottled water and sodas!
They do close at noon on Saturdays so make sure you get up early that day so you don’t have to settle going to Hanna’s instead and cursing yourself as you spread their dirty, trashy pine straw

text:
BEWARE! There are two separate businesses in Green Valley: the market and flowers and the landscaping.  You can judge the flowers for yourself and should get a good quality product.  I would recommend Porters just across the river for a much larger selection.
Now the BEWARE.  I hired Ken Irby to do my landscaping.  His crew did a good job.  As soon as the job was done and the sod laid I was very satisfied.  THEN IT RAINED.  I took pictures of the washed-out sod to the business and showed it to one of the landscapers.  He immediately said they did not put pins in the sod so it washed away.  I then went into the office and showed MR. IRBY.  He said he could fix it for over $1000.
I stated that since it was his workers' error it should not be that much.  He and I agreed to $800 to fix.  I know.  Why should I have to pay anything? As of today, November 4, 2020, I have not gotten responses from e-mails or calls.  I still have a mess and have waited too late to resod because MR. IRBY did not keep his word.  IF YOU DEAL WITH THIS MAN GET IT IN WRITING AS HE IS NOT TO BE TRUSTED.

In response to Mr. Irby.
You try and make yourself look like you will take care of a problem you created. (And charge me $800 to do so).  I REMIND YOU.  I came by your business and left a message, I called you,  left a message, I texted you and you did not contact me at all.(I can send copies)  You had my phone number, email and text and YOU INVITE ME TO CALL YOU.  I HOPE PEOPLE SEE THROUGH YOUR RESONSE THAT YOU WILL TAKE CARE OF us.  Please do not worry about the problem I will take care of it.

resp.text:
Steve,
Happy to get to your home and get this right.
Ken
256-648-1065 cell

text: I direct events for Billy Reid in Florence, Alabama and Green Valley is an incredible partner that elevates our event environments in a major way. text: Just finished second project with Green Valley Nursery and a third to be starting soon. They have been very friendly and knowledgeable. Will recommend them highly to anyone

name: Natalie Gregg
text:
Paid $950 for a job poorly done because I was immediately threatened by the owner Ken Irby that I would be handed over to collections, although before the job was even started he personally told me I didn’t have to pay until I was happy with the job.

First, he made an appointment to install a gravel driveway at our rental house on Monday. He (Green Valley Nursery & Landscape) never showed up that day. I questioned him, & he acted like he was doing me a favor by fitting me into his busy schedule. Told me he’d send a bobcat over to finish the job right then... I asked if the gravel was even at the job site, & he replied, “I have no idea! Guess I better check.” Wow! If that doesn’t tell you how unprofessional they are, I don’t know what does? Said he might be able to get the job done on Tuesday. I finally had him nail down a time for Friday, because I like a guaranteed job when I am paying for it. I felt like I had to babysit them to make sure the job would actually get done. Finally, the driveway was installed by people who are supposedly professionals. They literally just dropped off gravel & spread it out a bit. I’m not a professional landscaper, but all the research we found said that the gravel needed to be plate compacted through the process. He said they don’t do that, & he never promised me that. I only expected him to professionally & properly install a driveway... sorry, that’s what I thought they were. Professionals. Nope. He refused to fix the job, even though I was promised I wouldn’t have to pay until I was happy, & he would make it right. He told me he wanted to wash his hands of me, & wished I’d never bothered him. The gravel in this driveway is so loose that the first rain will wash it all out, it’s uneven, has a poorly graded slope that makes it hard to enter the drive without scraping the bottom of your car, & my husband couldn’t fit his Jeep in the carport anymore because there was so much gravel under it. They refused to fix it at the present cost, & said they would plate compact it for another $500. He said, “I’ll bill you, don’t pay it, & I’ll send you to collections. We’ll let the law handle it.” Unbelievable & awful experience. My husband & I could’ve done this job properly for as little as $700, but we decided to hire “pros” instead, & now, we are out $950, & it’s not even done right... meaning more expenses for us now. Do your research before hiring Ken Irby.

name: Darrel McColgan
text: Howdy.....I've been running an Irrigation Repair company in the greater Huntsville area for 20 years now.   I have been using Site One and it's previous name sakes (Century Rain Aid and John Deere) since 2000.  The name of the company (ownership) may have changed over the years but it has always consistently been my go to place.  Several of the current employees have been around for a quite a number of years.  The knowledge that they know and share is invaluable to the everyday needs of the landscape and irrigation industry layman.  If they don't have it they find a way to get it.  Their prices are competitive and they carry a variety of name brand parts.  During these trying times of COVID it's good to know that they are still trying to meet our demands and needs with the manufacturing industries struggles to keep up with new inventory.  Kudos to the whole staff at SiteOne for making it a little easier to continue to operate with limited resources at this time.

text:
Helpful, promptly fixing my things, even rushing to finish a belt replacement before closing time as I needed the vehicle the next morning.

I came in recently with a small issue. They pulled the bad part, found they hadn't a replacement or one in stock nearby, and gave it to me.

They offered to order one, but advised that ordering it myself would cost less, as it would circumvent their own overhead charges. They charged me nothing for the hour of work it took them to get to the part.

Overall honest and helpful across my 3 visits, with more coming.

My truck was towed to their shop at 1pm and I was back on the road by 2:40pm! Just outstanding service and fair rates. If you're anywhere near Luverne takes your vehicle to Stephen's Garage!
